result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danny Lee Schmidt

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Danny Lee Schmidt appeared by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks to Mr Schmidt's request to appoint counsel. Court advises to contact Attorney Hogan, who represents him in a different matter. Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Danny Lee Schmidt in court without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant mailed petition for court appointed counsel to the clerk's office last week.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.

1:12 PM Defendant Danny Lee Schmidt appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the complaint. Attorney rights given. State speaks to the case. Court issues at $500.00 CASH bond with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
